title.narrative: EDUCATION SYSTEM STRENGTHENING

description.narrative: Government at national and sub-national level have capacity to formulate evidence-based policies and strategies for delivering inclusive, gender sensitive quality education through formal and non-formal pathways., which contributes to Access To Quality Learning Opportunities, Climate Change, Disaster Risks And Envionmental Degradation, Cross-Sectoral - Social And Behaviour Change, Health And Development In Early Childhood And Adolescence, Immunization Services As Part Of Primary Health Care, Learning, Skills, Participation And Engagement, Mental Health And Psychosocial Well-Being, Nutrition Of Adolescents And Women. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Data, Research, Evaluation And Knowledge Management, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Evaluations, Research And Data, Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Harnessing Power Of Business And Markets, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind, United Nations Working Together. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: School-aged girls and boys, especially early adolescents (aged 10-14) [in targeted districts], acquire essential learning outcomes and practice skills for life, are safe from exploitation, harmful practices and violence, and benefit from integrated social services (including in emergencies).

participating-org.narrative: MINISTRY OF EDUCATION SCIENCE AND TECHNOLOGY

sector.narrative: Ending violence against women and girls
Strengthening data and national information systems, including routine systems, nutrition surveys and assessments (nutrition of school-age children, adolescents and women)
System strengthening - Education management information system (does not include learning assessment system)
System strengthening - Evidence based education sector planning
System strengthening - gender-responsive teaching and learning (excluding SRGBV)
System strengthening - teacher development, management, and support

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Government at national and sub-national level have capacity to formulate evidence-based policies and strategies for deliveringinclusive, gender sensitive quality education through formal and non-formal pathways.

description.narrative: UNICEF supported MoE to draft teacher policy aimed at strengthening teacher development and management.;In addition, a policy brief on the implementation of Free Secondary Education is available with key options on how to achieve this policy.The MoE deployed and migrated to an online web-based Education Management Information System (EMIS) with the technical support from UNICEF.To generate evidence on learning assessment, the MoE is administrating the Monitoring Learning Achievement survey and child protection (CP) in and through schools is gaining momentum through MoE high-level advocacy. COVID-19 standard operating procedures were developed for COVID-19 prevention and control in schools. | Status:Met | As-of Date:09/12/2021
